meanings.definition: to make a loud, harsh noise
meanings.sent1: The thunder blays outside my window.
meanings.sent2: The car horn blays loudly on the busy street.
meanings.sent3: The old radio blays its static-filled music.
meanings.sent4: The wind blays through the trees like a roaring beast.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks blays in the night sky, lighting up the darkness.

meanings.sent1: The blays of the construction site echoed through the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The sudden blays of the alarm startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The blays of the angry cat made us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: The blays of the storm were like drums beating in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The blays of the train whistle filled the station with sound.

meanings.sent1: The blays music from the party next door kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent2: The blays voice of the teacher could be heard down the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The blays sound of the broken speaker was comically distorted.
meanings.sent4: The blays wind outside made the windows rattle.
meanings.sent5: The blays laughter of the children filled the playground with joy.
